CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14 In particular , Guo et al. reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization. 14 Thiophene imide has simple , compact , symmetric , and planar structure. It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . Wudl et al. reported low - bandgap conjugated polymers based on thiophene - fused phthalimide , i.e. , isothianaphthene imides ( 5 , Figure 1 ). 25,26 2,2 0 -Bithiophene-3,3 0 -dicarboximide ( BTI , 6 , Figure 1 ) with π-core planarity , antiparallel BTI packing , a short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å , and a favorable solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n - type polymers. 27 Facchetti et al. reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping. On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. Guo et al. - Material Name: Guo et al.
2. thiophene - Material Name: thiophene
3. polythiophene - Material Name: polythiophene
4. thiophene imide - Material Name: thiophene imide
5. isothianaphthene imides - Material Name: isothianaphthene imides
6. BTI (2,2'-bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide) - Material Name: BTI
7. benzodithiophene - Material Name: benzodithiophene
8. BDT (benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b'0]dithiophene) - Material Name: BDT

Note that some of these entities may appear multiple times in the paragraph, but I have listed them only once under their respective Material Names.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. thiophene
2. polythiophene
3. thiophene imide
4. BTI
5. benzodithiophene

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid Material Names mentioned in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| thiophene |
| polythiophene |
| thiophene imide |
| BTI |
| benzodithiophene |

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

 * Property name: Polythiophene
2. Thiophene imide
 * Property name: Thiophene imide
3. Thiophene
 * Property name: Thiophene

 * Property name: Benzodithiophene

 * Property name: Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene
6. BTI (2,2-bithiophene-3,3-dicarboximide)
 * Property name: BTI (2,2-bithiophene-3,3-dicarboximide)
7. PC71BM (soluble fullerene derivative)
 * Property name: PC71BM (soluble fullerene derivative)
8. PC61BM (soluble fullerene derivative)

Note that some of these materials have multiple names or aliases, but I have listed the most commonly used names in the paragraph.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to property names of materials:

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14 In particular , Guo et al. reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization. 14 Thiophene imide has simple , compact , symmetric , and planar structure. It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . Wudl et al. reported low - bandgap conjugated polymers based on thiophene - fused phthalimide , i.e. , isothianaphthene imides ( 5 , Figure 1 ). 25,26 2,2 0 -Bithiophene-3,3 0 -dicarboximide ( BTI , 6 , Figure 1 ) with π-core planarity , antiparallel BTI packing , a short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å , and a favorable solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n - type polymers. 27 Facchetti et al. reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping. On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the material properties and their values mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Hole mobility:
The paragraph mentions that the hole mobility of OFETs based on a phthalimide-containing polythiophene is around 0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization.
2. Bandgap:
The paragraph does not mention the bandgap of any material directly. However, it does mention that the fused-ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly induce face-to-face π-stacking, which can facilitate charge transport through intermolecular hopping. This suggests that the bandgap of the materials mentioned in the paragraph may be relatively narrow.
3. Solubility:
The paragraph mentions that the solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n-type polymers. This suggests that the materials mentioned in the paragraph are soluble in a solvent.
4. Crystallinity:
The paragraph does not mention the crystallinity of any material directly. However, it does mention that the fused-ring building blocks are widely used in the synthesis of conjugated polymers, which suggests that the materials mentioned in the paragraph may be crystalline.
5. Molecular weight:
The paragraph does not mention the molecular weight of any material directly. However, it does mention that the large planar benzodithiophene (BDT) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. This suggests that the materials mentioned in the paragraph may have a relatively high molecular weight.
6. Ionization potential (IP):
The paragraph mentions that the incorporation of the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene (BDT) unit into the copolymer backbone increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. This suggests that the IP of the materials mentioned in the paragraph may be relatively high.
7. Hole transport distance:
The paragraph does not mention the hole transport distance of any material directly. However, it does mention that the fused-ring system can facilitate charge transport through intermolecular hopping, which suggests that the hole transport distance may be relatively short.
8. Conductivity:
The paragraph mentions that OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on a flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V. This suggests that the materials mentioned in the paragraph are conductive.

Values:

* Hole mobility: 0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions without optimization)
* Bandgap: Not mentioned directly, but suggested to be relatively narrow due to the fused-ring system.
* Solubility: Promising building block in n-type polymers.
* Crystallinity: Not mentioned directly, but suggested to be crystalline due to the fused-ring building blocks.
* Molecular weight: Relatively high due to the large planar BDT unit.
* Ionization potential (IP): Higher due to the incorporation of the BDT unit.
* Hole transport distance: Relatively short due to the fused-ring system.
* Conductivity: High (0.5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1) due to the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. "0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1" - This is the value of the hole mobility mentioned in the text.
2. "60 V" - This is the value of the source-gate voltage mentioned in the text.
3. "0.5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1" - This is the value of the hole mobility mentioned in the text, which is higher than the previous value.

So, the two relevant entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given text are:

1. "0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1"
2. "0.5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1"
